description: In Algeria, the Ministry of National Education have announced on 22nd of July the protocols for preventive and health measures in the centers for conducting the intermediate education certificate and baccalaureate exams of 2020. description:
In Algeria, the economic, commercial and service activities will resume, in two phases. The first phase is in effect from 7 June 2020. 
The first phase concerns the resumption of activities in the building and civil engineering industry, including subcontracting activities and design offices (architecture, urban planning), with the organization of personnel transport, at the expense of the companies, which will be authorized to circulate throughout the national territory from 05:00 in the morning until 19:00, in line with the relevant health and safety regulations. 
It will also concern ceramic craftsmen, plumbers, carpenters, painters, travel agencies, real estate agencies, the sale of handicraft products, shoemaking and tailoring activities, as well as maintenance and repair activities.
Also concerns the sale of household and decoration goods, the sale of sporting equipment, the sale of games and toys, pastries and confectionery, the take-away sale of ice cream and drinks, fast food (take-away only), trade in bedding and upholstery, trade in household appliances, sale of cosmetics and hygiene products, trade in flowers, nurseries and herbalists, photographic studios and photocopying activities.
Showers with the exception of hammams, maintenance, vehicle repair and washing, art galleries, sale of musical instruments, antique and second-hand shops, bookshops and stationery stores, men’s hairdressers, and livestock markets are also included in the activity resumption plan.

All these stores are allowed to open under strict conditions in order to prevent the spread of COVID-19. All customers must have a protective mask and that the managers of the facilities will be held responsible for non-compliance with this obligation.

description:
Algeria have announced the resumption of commercial and service activities throughout the entire provinces of the country starting from 14th of June 2020. The resumption of the commercial services and activities are: women hair salon, car rental store, shoes and clothes retailers. These commercial services are allowed to open under health conditions. 
Shoes and clothes retailers must have antiseptic alcohol solution, prohibiting fitting rooms for clothes and there must be single-use plastic bags for trying shoes and the obligation of wearing protective masks for the customer and the employer. 
Women hair salons must offer their services by appointments, the customer and the hair stylist are obliged to wear protective wearing masks, only 2 customers are allowed to enter the salon, regular cleaning the shop and every items and supplied used must be disinfected frequently. 
Car rental stores must oblige the customers and employers in wear protective masks, organising entrances and queues outside and inside stores in a manner that allows respect for social distancing and physical distance, placing clear signs on the ground to avoid customer intersection, putting disinfectant wipes for shoes in the entrances, cleaning the stores and disinfecting daily, disinfection of banknotes and coins, providing special boxes for disposing of masks, gloves, medical equipment used and tissues.

Everyone must wear protective masks and the trainer must be equipped with protection supplies (a protective mask and face protection) and keep away from the participants during the training, while respecting a distance of 3 meters between each device, so that each participant can benefit from an area of 16 square meters.
